member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY
member.summary: Identifies the granularity at which the graphics processing unit (GPU) can be preempted from performing its current graphics rendering task.

member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY.DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_DMA_BUFFER_BOUNDARY
member.summary: Indicates the preemption granularity as a DMA buffer.

member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY.DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_PRIMITIVE_BOUNDARY
member.summary: Indicates the preemption granularity as a graphics primitive. A primitive is a section in a DMA buffer and can be a group of triangles.

member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY.DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_TRIANGLE_BOUNDARY
member.summary: Indicates the preemption granularity as a triangle. A triangle is a part of a primitive.

member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY.DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_PIXEL_BOUNDARY
member.summary: Indicates the preemption granularity as a pixel. A pixel is a part of a triangle.

member.name: DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_GRANULARITY.DXGI_GRAPHICS_PREEMPTION_INSTRUCTION_BOUNDARY
member.summary: Indicates the preemption granularity as a graphics instruction. A graphics instruction operates on a pixel.
